rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOG-METHODS;25377fd5.1502">   <title>Irish Journal of Sociology </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOG-METHODS;25377fd5.1502</link>   <description> Please consider the Irish Journal of Sociology. Apologies for cross positing.<br><br>Submit your work to the Irish Journal of Sociology&lt;http://www.manchesteruniversitypress.co.uk/cgi-bin/scribe?showgroup=ig03&gt;<br><br>The IJS&lt;http://www.manchesteruniversitypress.co.uk/cgi-bin/scribe?showinfo=ip024&gt; advances sociological research about Irish society as well as publishing high-quality papers not related to Ireland. We are particularly interested in papers of a comparative nature. The journal accepts papers in six categories: original articles, research notes, archives, databases, debates, and trends. It also publishes solicited book reviews. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-07T12:43:40+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Goodwin, John D. (Prof.)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOG-METHODS;25377fd5.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOG-METHODS;1f73c788.1501">   <title>BNIM (Biographic Narrative Interpretive Method) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOG-METHODS;1f73c788.1501</link>   <description> I thought I would circulate some information about recent theses and<br>publications that were BNIM-based and BNIM-using. I then realised there were<br>quite a lot and it was fun and surprising to extract the full range for<br>2014.<br><br>I attach the 2014 list for those interested.<br><br>Two encouraging statistics (not using SPSS):<br><br>. Over the year, there were 10 theses and two published books:<br>precise [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-25T10:48:14-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Tom Wengraf</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOG-METHODS;1f73c788.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOG-METHODS;80baad32.1501">   <title>Writing across Boundaries, 12/13 March, 2015, Penthouse Suite, Collingwood College, Durham University, UK. </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOG-METHODS;80baad32.1501</link>   <description> Dear Colleague (and apologies for cross posting)<br><br>If you are supervising a 3rd (or 4th) year doctoral candidate in the social sciences who is engaged in writing up qualitative data, then you might be interested in applying for them to attend the annual Writing Across Boundaries workshop. This is the sixth year that this very well-received and popular doctoral writing workshop has run, and the fourth time that we are accepting nominations from outside the UK, as well as from British universities. The workshop now runs as an advanced training workshop of the ESRC North East Doctoral Training Centre. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-19T11:30:29+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Robin Humphrey</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOG-METHODS;80baad32.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOG-METHODS;677b5e5f.1410">   <title>Call for Submissions ICQI 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOG-METHODS;677b5e5f.1410</link>   <description> In response to recent actions taken by the Administration at the University of<br>Illinois, the 2015 Congress of Qualitative Inquiry (QI2015) is inviting<br>paper, poster, and panel submissions on the topics of the academy, freedom of<br>speech, tenure, and faculty appointments. Since its founding, ICQI has been<br>a forum for critical conversations about the role of scholarship in<br>advancing qualitative inquiry as a democratic practice. The tenets of<br>freedom of speech and academicfreedom are integral to these discussions. We<br>stand by our mission to be leaders in fostering research and pedagogy that<br>engages the pressing social issues of our time. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-03T14:38:45-04:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Norman Denzin</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOG-METHODS;677b5e5f.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOG-METHODS;9f65ba5.1409">   <title>11th International Congress of Qualitative Inquiry (QI2015) taking Submissions </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOG-METHODS;9f65ba5.1409</link>   <description> The theme of the 2015 Congress is \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdConstructing A New Critical Qualitative<br>Inquiry.\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd The International Congress of Qualitative Inquiry (ICQI) will be<br>starting its second decade in 2015. The first decade of the Congress capped<br>a century and more of efforts by qualitative researchers to understand and<br>transform our worlds through critical interpretive inquiry. The second<br>decade charts a promising future. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-09T10:08:15-04:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Norman Denzin</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOG-METHODS;9f65ba5.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOG-METHODS;21a8d1c4.1407">   <title>BNIM 5-Day Intensive - Galway in September - Biographic-Narrative Interpretive Method - 39th </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOG-METHODS;21a8d1c4.1407</link>   <description> Hi!<br><br>If you are interested in participating in a 5-day BNIM intensive, in Galway<br>rather than London where it usually runs, do download the attached flyer.<br><br>If you can think of somebody else who might be interested, please forward<br>this email to them.<br><br>Best wishes<br><br>Tom    </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-04T14:38:07+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Tom Wengraf</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOG-METHODS;21a8d1c4.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOG-METHODS;5ac71e52.1406">   <title>London Intensive Training in biographic narrative method (BNIM) - November 2014 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOG-METHODS;5ac71e52.1406</link>   <description> Thirty-eighth<br><br>November 2014<br><br>Five-Day Training Intensive<br><br>in the<br><br>Biographic-Narrative-Interpretive Method<br><br>BNIM<br><br>Narrative Interview and Interpretation<br><br>5 days for 6 people:<br><br>2014 Thursday-Friday November 6th - 7th ;<br><br>and then Monday-Wednesday November 10th to 12th<br><br>at<br><br>24a Princes Avenue, London N10 3LR<br><br>Muswell Hill, North London, United Kingdom<br><br>Finding good methods for doing social research that is genuinely concerned<br>with the macro-societal, the meso-institutional and also with an informed<br>concern for subjectivity and 'the inner world' is not easy. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-06-11T09:20:40+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Tom Wengraf</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BIOG-METHODS;5ac71e52.1406</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
